Articles.Content:
DL is broken, here's a working one:

https://github.com/waka324/VisualEnhancements/releases/download/6-0/VisualEnhancments-6-0.zip

Well, I just took a quick peek and I guess I'll be the first to say they look really nice. I'll get a much better look at it tomorrow, but I can see the improvement at the poles. If you consider the crazy, swirling madness this mod started with, how could I not be impressed?
Personally I miss the swirl. But at the same time it does make more sense for clouds to not be arranged in an angry perpetual storm.
Poles look ALOT Better, gonna miss the swirl, but it looks way better now.
this mod does not change anything for me. I put all the folders in gameplay but When i put a rocket on the launch pad and look up the sky looks exactly the same. There are no clouds.

DL is broken, here's a working one:

https://github.com/waka324/VisualEnhancements/releases/download/6-0/VisualEnhancments-6-0.zip

Thank you

this mod does not change anything for me. I put all the folders in gameplay but When i put a rocket on the launch pad and look up the sky looks exactly the same. There are no clouds.

Extract the rar file to your main folder. Or...extract the Folder "BoulderCo" to your gamedata folder.

Extract the rar file to your main folder. Or...extract the Folder "BoulderCo" to your gamedata folder.

Yeah I've got the mod installed correctly. But there are no clouds when i look up. i dont know why.

Yeah I've got the mod installed correctly. But there are no clouds when i look up. i dont know why.

Tried time warping a bit? Could be that you just have a clear day.
Try poking around the map view/tracking station too.

Yeah I've got the mod installed correctly. But there are no clouds when i look up. i dont know why.

Are you using Linux? I have no clouds when I look up in Linux, although they work fine in Mac OSX.
6.0 bring me a back to desktop at start desk.

I spent 3 seconds playing with the provided web link and found this:

You're welcome.
SOMEONE can help me please? I just want to know how to load/supply textures! -.- do i asking to much?
Version 6-0 doesn't work for me. W7

@ Mucha - What rbay was trying to tell you is: bring up the alt-n menu (I think you have to pick advanced options), and notice each layer allows you to specify the textures it uses. That will give you the directory format you need to reference one of your own. If you open your BoulderCo folder, look in the clouds folder, inside is another one called textures. You can find all the textures the mod is referencing there. If you need further help, feel free to ask.

I don't recommend using non-square textures, to be honest. They are pretty badly managed by the GPU and in worst cases can be automatically converted to a square of a nearest size, thus adding dead weight without actually using it for anything useful.

Non-square textures aren't a problem. Non-power-of-2 textures can be a problem, depending on what generation of GPU you're using.

https://github.com/waka324/VisualEnhancements/releases/tag/6-0

Hello, there is a problem with v6.

When I run vanilla KSP it uses about 1450mb of ram. Just adding v6 of this plugin jumps that up to 2000-2200mb.

Whatever you changed in 6-0 regarding to 5-3 i don't like it, it now produces a visible could-pattern on the equator. i rather live with some strange effects on the poles tbh.

to illustrate - BEFORE (5-3)

AFTER (6-0)
So, anyone else getting the city lights floating like clouds on the night side of the planet? Or did the Kerbals develop floating cities while I wasn't looking?

I can't run 6-0. I get CTD either at the end of loading, or, if I get through that, when I transition from scenes. If I look at memory usage while at the space center screen, switching from 5-2 or 5-3 to 6-0 causes KSP's memory usage to jump from 2.5 gigs to over 3.3 (! ). I stripped out Laythe, Duna, and Eve's clouds, which doesn't add up to much.

EDIT: And I also am seeing the debug spam in the log.

Edited December 22, 2013 by MOARdV
Added note about debug output.

Whatever you changed in 6-0 regarding to 5-3 i don't like it, it now produces a visible could-pattern on the equator. i rather live with some strange effects on the poles tbh.

to illustrate - BEFORE (5-3)
